hints.content: To divide a shape in half, we divide the whole into **$2$ equal parts**.

These circles are divided into $3$ pieces:  

![A circle divided into 3 equal parts.](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/b380a840c8febc1b9000c7ab75c4f35f7f748a82)
![A circle is divided into 3 unequal parts. 1 part is over half the circle. The other 2 parts are less than one-fourth the circle.](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/dc78445f790809410b0e7c31aceb9a84b1d8c608)

These circles are divided into halves:  

![2 circles. Each one is divided into 2 equal parts.](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/46d14851c942db6ccae854e1c9c87615ab2c9348)  ![](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/4b4755e6e6688401738524f53e4fc4a097911069)

question.content:
**Which circles are divided into halves?**

choices.content: ![A circle has a line passing through the center dividing it into 2 parts.](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/4b4755e6e6688401738524f53e4fc4a097911069)
![A circle has a line passing through the center dividing it into 2 parts.](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/46d14851c942db6ccae854e1c9c87615ab2c9348)

![A circle is divided into 3 unequal parts. 1 part is over half the circle. The other 2 parts are less than one-fourth the circle.](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/dc78445f790809410b0e7c31aceb9a84b1d8c608)
